section.name: SMTP Security
section.p: Apache James Server is configured by default to avoid being an SMTP open-relay.
SMTP Auth and "Verify Identity" options are enabled when you install James (read more).

section.name: Encryption Security
section.p: Apache James Server supports SSL/TLS (read more).

section.name: User Credential Security
section.p: Apache James Server supports different user storage (read more) - LDAP support is partail (work in progress).

subsection.name: Apache James 3.0.0
subsection.p: The Apache James Server version 3.0.0 is vulnerable to Java deserialization issues.
One can use this for privilege escalation.
This issue can be mitigated by:

ul.li: Using a recent JRE (Exploit could not be reproduced on OpenJdk 8 u141)
Exposing JMX socket only to localhost (default behaviour)
Possibly running James in a container
